brief_summary.textblock:
Establishment of a range of normal values in pregnancy with the Multiple Electrode
      Aggregometry (Multiplate@) device, a device that allows measurement of not only platelet
      count but platelet function. This has not been studied in ths special patient group. Results
      from this trial will be used as a basis for further investigation of abnormal platelet
      function in pregnancy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Platelet Function in Pregnancy With Multiple Electrode Aggregometry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Rejection of informed consent

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant patients above the age of majority

intervention.description: Observation of platelet function in pregnancy
intervention.intervention_name: Platelet function during pregnancy Multiple Electrode Aggregometry (Multiplate@) device

facility.name: Universitätsklinik für Frauenheilkunde, Allgemeines Krankenhaus der Stadt Wien

clinical_study.official_title: Multiple Electrode Aggregometry and Platelet Function in Pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesia, General Intensive Care and Pain Management, Medical University Vienna

primary_outcome.description:
Measurement of change of platelet function by the Multiplate® device. First measurement (baseline measurement) at enrollment into the trial. Second measurement during government-mandated gynaecological evaluation, around the 20th week of pregnancy.
Third measurement immediately prior to delivery. Last measurement one week after delivery. 2nd, 3rd and 4th measurement for assessment of change from baseline.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Record of bleeding events, preeclampsia, HELLP (hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelet count) syndrome.
Time points: at every assessment of primary outcome measure, as described above.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
